results.title: Die Zauberflote = The Magic flute / Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
results.brief_description: Wolfgang Sawallisch conducts the choir and orchestra of the Bayerischen Staatsoper, in this often unsuccesful masterpiece. The director, August Everding, in the 27p. booklet accompanying this video, sees Man, bound together by body and soul, as the principal character of this great drama which describes the road from Nature to Civilisation, and which seeks to reconcile the duality of dark and light, good and evil. The singers include Lucia Popp, Edita Gruberova, Francisco Araiza, Wolfgang Brendel and Kurt Moll. Sung in German.

results.title: Paul Kane goes west
results.creator_credit: Gerald Budner, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: His canvases breathe with the spirit and pride of the Indian, and the untouched wilderness that was his domain. Travelling overland west to the Pacific in the mid-1800s, Paul Kane painted the northwest, the great Indian tribes, chiefs, ceremonies, war parties, buffalo hunts, rapids and waterfalls. In this film his paintings are projected with lighting that brings to life every glowing detail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Budner, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Paul Bocuse. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Didi von Rossek and Aida United
results.brief_description: Internationally recognised as one of the greatest living chefs, Paul Bocuse was made a member of the Legion d’Hooneur in recognition of his services as an ambassador of French cuisine. In this video he includes clear, step-by-step instructions for making Coq au Vin and Baked Apples. The ingredients are printed following each recipe. Bocuse’s love and joy for cooking and teaching cooking are clearly evident.
results.description: Internationally recognised as one of the greatest living chefs, Paul Bocuse was made a member of the Legion d’Hooneur in recognition of his services as an ambassador of French cuisine. results.title: Paul Bocuse. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Didi von Rossek and Aida United
results.brief_description: These programs present Paul Bocuse’s favourite recipes for real food cooked at home in the simplest ways. From the first menu to the last, the six menus are all perfectly balanced; some simple and homely cuisine, others more elegant and elaborate. All the recipes are easy, with short, clear instructions that anyone can follow. Once you know how to prepare these meals you will be ready every occasion, especially as the recipes are accompanied by Paul Bocuse’s advice on how to vary the ingredients depending on the season, sensible shopping, etc. In this video he includes easy instructions, and printed guidelines for buying the necessary ingredients for both Veal Kidney Roast and Chocalte Mousse.

results.title: Paul-Emile Borduas, (1905-1960)
results.creator_credit: Jacques Godbout and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of the career of Candian artist Paul-Emile Borduas, showing all his painting styles - his surrealism, his cubism, his automatism, as well as his early workd while he was still apprenticed to Ozias Leduc.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques Godbout and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Patterns of Landscape: Fred Williams 1927-1982
results.creator_credit: Christina Wilcox, Wilcox, Lisa Noonan and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Fred Williams’ works have changed the way we look at Australian landscape. His paintings have broken down the convention of what Australian landscape art represented to its people, and more importantly what it projected about Australia to the world. This is a visually challenging and historical account of the life and times of the late Fred Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Wilcox, Wilcox, Lisa Noonan and Film Australia

results.title: Patterns of change
results.creator_credit: J William Walker, James J. Cullen and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Minorities”.
Discusses the conditions of minority groups today, exploring both points of view. One view is that minority groups are following patterns of change similar to minority groups of the past, and the other is that today the struggle of minority groups has become harder.

results.title: In the name of religion
results.creator_credit: J William Walker, James J. Cullen and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Minorities”.
Although religious freedom is guaranteed by the U.S. Constitution, prejudice against minority religious groups is a strong feature of American society. This film traces history of immigration and the growth of intolerance and persecution of religious minorities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J William Walker, James J. Cullen and Coronet Instructional Films
